content: cute mini octopus by drpepperholik supplies ● yarn - can use anything from sport weight to bulky like chenille such as bernat blanket ● crochet hook - size is based on the yarn choice see the sizing section for suggested sizes and notes based on yarn size ● safety eyes - 6mm for smaller yarns or up to 12mm for bulky yarns ● polyfill ● yarn needle abbreviations ● magic_ring - magic_ring or magic_ring ● single_crochet - single_crochet ● half_double_crochet - half_double_crochet ● slip_stitch - slip_stitch ● fl - front loop ● flo - front loop only ● bl - back loop ● blo - back loop only ● yo - yarn over ● increase - increase do 2 single_crochet stitches in one stitch ● inv decrease - invisible decrease insert hook into flo of the next st and the st after that yo and pull loop through both fls so you have 2 loops on your hook yo then pull through both loops on hook body the body can be worked in continuous rounds spiral or you can place a slip_stitch at the end of each round to keep it even all around note that this will show a line in the back place a stitch marker in the first stitch of each round round 1 in magic_ring do 6 single_crochet close ring 6 sts round 2 single_crochet increase in each st 12 sts round 3 single_crochet increase x 4 18 sts round 4 2 single_crochet increase x 6 24 sts rnds 5 - 7 single_crochet in each st 24 sts insert safety eyes between rounds 5 and 6 with 3 visible stitches between them round 8 single_crochet inv decrease x 8 16 sts stuff the octopus to your desired firmness do not overfill round 9 inv decrease all around 8 sts tentacles choose from one of the three styles of tentacles note that the shorter length or wavy style tentacles is not recommended when using a smaller yarn with a smaller hook as it is difficult to work for either style place a stitch marker in blo of the next st on the body to help find the start of the round after completing all the tentacles longer or curly style 1 single_crochet in flo of next st on body this should be where the stitch marker was placed 2 chain 5 single_crochet in 2nd chain from hook 2 single_crochet in next 3 sts slip_stitch in the fl that you started the tentacle in * repeat this for each tentacle 3 on the last tentacle chain 1 a optional step inv decrease in the blo of round 9 this should be where you put your stitch marker before beginning the tentacles 4 cut your yarn leaving a long tail for closing the bottom of your octopus 5 thread the yarn needle and insert it into the blo from the inside/center of the octopus to the outside starting where your stitch marker is when you started the tentacles and
